item.title: Broken glass on children's play equipment, 27th September
item.description:
Second instance in recent weeks of broken glass bottles on children's play equipment in Queen Elizabeth 2 park. Anti-social behaviour is clearly not being taken seriously. Discarded clothes and drug paraphernalia also littering the park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saxon Way, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Quantity recycling ‚ôªÔ∏è Materials Dumped, 27th September
item.description:
Resident asks: Could we have more recycling bins to prevent this happening every two weeks with cardboard being blown around the car park and into Cowl Lane ? If this is business waste, please investigate, if this is residential waste, please provide residents with more recycling ‚ôªÔ∏è bin capacity. Thank you.üôè

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowl Lane, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Street lamp is not working for weeks!, 26th September
item.description:
This light is right at the entrance to the foot path leading across the stream. It makes the area very dark and scary for the kids walking in this area at before dawn or after dusk. A conservative estimate would say it has been weeks since this light was working - my daughter walks this way when dark weekly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glenfall Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Signs and Barriers, 26th September
item.description:
There have been some abandoned road work barriers and signs here for several months now (one way street leading to queens retreat). They are obstructing the path and very often end up pushed into the road. Please could these be removed, thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 88, Gloucester Road, Alstone, Cheltenham
